reporter_caption.center: CIRAOLO v. CONTINENTAL CASUALTY INSURANCE COMPANY, 150 N.J. 22 (1997)

caption.center: EDMOND CIRAOLO v. CONTINENTAL CASUALTY INSURANCE COMPANY.

opinion.opinion_text: Certification is granted and the matter is summarily remanded to the Law Division for the entry of judgment in the favor of plaintiff unless the policy language precludes coverage. SeeFrench v. New Jersey School Board Association Insurance Group,149 N.J. 478, 694 A.2d 1008 (1997).Page 23
